Author: rms
Content: I never noticed these and figured other people also hadn't.

Author: dcurtis
Content:
They're not talking about straight web applications, they're talking about using the internet as a new distribution method. The financial requirements of filming a TV show still apply, no matter how it's distributed, so they obviously need to to negotiate with investors to get the money for something like this.

If the buzzword "web 3.0" could be applied to anything, it will probably apply to this kind of stuff.

Author: cellis
Content: Very interesting to me. But I know very little about Artificial Intelligence or ML.

Author: akkartik
Content:
It's one thing to notice that beginners can sometimes make contributions by luck, just by not knowing how hard something is supposed to be. It's another to use this reasoning to glorify lack of knowledge.

Whenever I see someone succeed rapidly I assume it isn't a newcomer, that there are depths of effort I cannot yet see.

Author: pchristensen
Content: Ah, the joys of having fine grained control over every user's experience with up to the minute modifications.  Hooray for web-delivered software!

Author: downer
Content:
"Doubt clouds the family itself: 70 percent of Italians between 20 and 30 still live at home, condemning the young to an extended and underproductive adolescence."

Cost of living. In the U.S., most college graduates can't afford to live on their own in major cities. Jobs require ever-more qualifications and advanced degrees. Productivity goes out the door and escapism comes in when you're stuck with your parents.

That housing bubble was horrible for the economy. Far from a sign of good things happening, it meant owning their own home was out of reach for the vast majority of young people. The amount of productivity and joie de vivre lost cannot be overestimated. Being stuck living with people you don't want to live with is toxic (that includes non-family members, too).

Author: sosuke
Content: Maybe it was the article or lack of Google-able content but I just wasn't as impressed as I was prepared to be. I couldn't find a site for Cyquester Technologies other than freelance style systems and couldn't find any additional details on the sale of the Facebook app by the other kid but it seems to be a low dollar sale for a simple application. If anyone has additional information I would love to take a look!

Author: neilc
Content:
Yeah, that's definitely a nice, practical book for machine learning stuff (but not really AI proper). For a practical book on AI itself, Norvig's Paradigms of Artificial Intelligence Programming:

http://norvig.com/paip.html

is a great book, and a nice complement to Norvig and Russell, which is somewhat more theory-oriented.

Author: downer
Content:
Doing what has been done in the field would repeat the mistakes.

Doing something original might actually be, you know, original.

Author: pg
Content: Those lessons can be useful, though.  You might make the same mistakes.
